numismatic_provenance_s: Classical Numismatic Group, Lancaster, PA; 01/11/2005; Triton VIII (696)
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: crown cap ending in head of falcon, holding pearl in his beak; cheek flaps, on lower part of cap symbol (SNS 3, var. 25); diadem ribbons pointing to the left; neck-line of tunica edged with double pearl row; dotted border
issue_obverse_legend_s: 11 h l. o.  mzdysn bgy šhpwhry MRKAn MRKA 'yr'n MNW ctry MN yzd'n/mazdēsn bay Šābuhr šāhān šāh Ērān kē čihr az yazdān/"the Mazda-worshiping, divine Shapur, King of Kings of the Iranians, whose image/brilliance is from the gods"
issue_reverse_figure_description_s: base consisting of two elements; round altar shaft; four altar slabs; altar flames depicted with parallel strokes; to the left and right of the altar attendant with stylized crown of Shapur I without korymbos, facing outwards, holding lance in right hand respectively, left and right hand respectively resting on scabbard; dotted border
issue_reverse_legend_s: 9 h l.o. NWRA ZY, 3 h l. o.  Šhpwhry/ ādur ī Šābuhr/“the fire of Shapur”
